text: Resolution 1373 (2001)

Adopted by the Security Council at its 4385th meeting, on 
28 September 2001
The Security Council,
Reaffirming its resolutions 1269 (1999) of 19 October 1999 and 1368 (2001) of 12 September 2001,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolutions 1269 (1999) of 19 October 1999 and 1368 (2001) of 12 September 2001,

text: Reaffirming also its unequivocal condemnation of the terrorist attacks which took place in New York, Washington, D.C. and Pennsylvania on 11 September 2001, and expressing its determination to prevent all such acts,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* also its unequivocal condemnation of the terrorist attacks which took place in New York, Washington, D.C. and Pennsylvania on 11 September 2001, and *expressing* its determination to prevent all such acts,

text: Reaffirming further that such acts, like any act of international terrorism, constitute a threat to international peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming further* that such acts, like any act of international terrorism, constitute a threat to international peace and security,

text: Reaffirming the inherent right of individual or collective self-defence as recognized by the Charter of the United Nations as reiterated in resolution 1368 (2001),
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the inherent right of individual or collective self-defence as recognized by the Charter of the United Nations as reiterated in resolution 1368 (2001),

text: Reaffirming the need to combat by all means, in accordance with the Charter of the United Nations, threats to international peace and security caused by terrorist acts,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the need to combat by all means, in accordance with the Charter of the {{United Nations}}, threats to international peace and security caused by terrorist acts,

text: Deeply concerned by the increase, in various regions of the world, of acts of terrorism motivated by intolerance or extremism,
textWithHighlights: *Deeply concerned* by the increase, in various regions of the world, of acts of terrorism motivated by intolerance or extremism,

text: Calling on States to work together urgently to prevent and suppress terrorist acts, including through increased cooperation and full implementation of the relevant international conventions relating to terrorism,
textWithHighlights: *Calling on* {{States}} to work together urgently to prevent and suppress terrorist acts, including through increased cooperation and full implementation of the relevant international conventions relating to terrorism,
uncertainties: This is a preambular paragraph using directive language ('Calling on'). In preambular paragraphs, we do not assign assignees, so 'States' is treated as a mentioned entity rather than an assignee.

text: Recognizing the need for States to complement international cooperation by taking additional measures to prevent and suppress, in their territories through all lawful means, the financing and preparation of any acts of terrorism,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the need for {{States}} to complement international cooperation by taking additional measures to prevent and suppress, in their territories through all lawful means, the financing and preparation of any acts of terrorism,

text: Reaffirming the principle established by the General Assembly in its declaration of October 1970 (resolution 2625 (XXV)) and reiterated by the Security Council in its resolution 1189 (1998) of 13 August 1998, namely that every State has the duty to refrain from organizing, instigating, assisting or participating in terrorist acts in another State or acquiescing in organized activities within its territory directed towards the commission of such acts,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the principle established by the {{General Assembly}} in its declaration of October 1970 (resolution 2625 (XXV)) and reiterated by the {{Security Council}} in its resolution 1189 (1998) of 13 August 1998, namely that {{every State}} has the duty to refrain from organizing, instigating, assisting or participating in terrorist acts in another State or acquiescing in organized activities within its territory directed towards the commission of such acts,

text: Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter of the {{United Nations}},

text: Decides that all States shall:
textWithHighlights: *Decides* that {{all States}} shall:
uncertainties: This appears to be a chapeau introducing subparagraphs that will assign tasks to Member States; no concrete deliverables are present in this line. Assignee set implicitly to the Security Council per the deciding verb.

text: Prevent and suppress the financing of terrorist acts;
textWithHighlights: Prevent and suppress the financing of terrorist acts;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause. The clause describes an obligation but does not map cleanly to a specific deliverable type (e.g., report/meeting/policy), so no deliverable is recorded.

text: Criminalize the wilful provision or collection, by any means, directly or indirectly, of funds by their nationals or in their territories with the intention that the funds should be used, or in the knowledge that they are to be used, in order to carry out terrorist acts;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Criminalization of financing of terrorism

textWithHighlights: [[Criminalize]] the wilful provision or collection, by any means, directly or indirectly, of funds by their nationals or in their territories with the intention that the funds should be used, or in the knowledge that they are to be used, in order to carry out terrorist acts;

text: Freeze without delay funds and other financial assets or economic resources of persons who commit, or attempt to commit, terrorist acts or participate in or facilitate the commission of terrorist acts; of entities owned or controlled directly or indirectly by such persons; and of persons and entities acting on behalf of, or at the direction of such persons and entities, including funds derived or generated from property owned or controlled directly or indirectly by such persons and associated persons and entities;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Asset freeze targeting terrorists and associated entities

textWithHighlights: [[Freeze]] without delay funds and other financial assets or economic resources of persons who commit, or attempt to commit, terrorist acts or participate in or facilitate the commission of terrorist acts; of entities owned or controlled directly or indirectly by such persons; and of persons and entities acting on behalf of, or at the direction of such persons and entities, including funds derived or generated from property owned or controlled directly or indirectly by such persons and associated persons and entities;
uncertainties: Deliverable type is approximated as 'policy' since 'asset freeze' is a sanctions/enforcement measure rather than documentation or funding; categories do not include a specific 'sanctions' type.

text: Prohibit their nationals or any persons and entities within their territories from making any funds, financial assets or economic resources or financial or other related services available, directly or indirectly, for the benefit of persons who commit or attempt to commit or facilitate or participate in the commission of terrorist acts, of entities owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by such persons and of persons and entities acting on behalf of or at the direction of such persons;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Prohibition on making funds and services available to terrorists

textWithHighlights: [[Prohibit]] their nationals or any persons and entities within their territories from making any funds, financial assets or economic resources or financial or other related services available, directly or indirectly, for the benefit of persons who commit or attempt to commit or facilitate or participate in the commission of terrorist acts, of entities owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by such persons and of persons and entities acting on behalf of or at the direction of such persons;
uncertainties: Assignee is implicitly "all States" inherited from the parent clause, but it does not appear in this subparagraph text; to maintain highlight consistency, the assignees list is left empty.

text: Decides also that all States shall:
textWithHighlights: *Decides* also that all <<States>> shall:
uncertainties: Normalized 'all States' to 'Member States' as per entity list.

text: Refrain from providing any form of support, active or passive, to entities or persons involved in terrorist acts, including by suppressing recruitment of members of terrorist groups and eliminating the supply of weapons to terrorists;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Refrain from providing support to terrorists
deliverables.deliverable: Refrain from providing any form of support

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Suppress recruitment of members of terrorist groups
Eliminate supply of weapons to terrorists

textWithHighlights: [[Refrain from providing any form of support]], active or passive, to entities or persons involved in terrorist acts, including by [[suppressing recruitment]] of members of terrorist groups and [[eliminating the supply of weapons]] to terrorists;
uncertainties: Operative verb is inherited from the parent clause ('Decides ...'). Deliverable types are approximated as 'policy' since these are behavioral/prohibitive measures rather than documents or resources.

text: Take the necessary steps to prevent the commission of terrorist acts, including by provision of early warning to other States by exchange of information;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Early warning
Information exchange

textWithHighlights: Take the necessary steps to prevent the commission of terrorist acts, including by provision of [[early warning]] to {{other States}} by [[exchange of information]];

text: Deny safe haven to those who finance, plan, support, or commit terrorist acts, or provide safe havens;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Deny safe haven to persons involved in terrorist acts

textWithHighlights: [[Deny safe haven]] to those who finance, plan, support, or commit terrorist acts, or provide safe havens;
uncertainties: Deliverable type categorized as 'policy'; could also be interpreted as enforcement or require 'legislation' depending on implementation context.

text: Prevent those who finance, plan, facilitate or commit terrorist acts from using their respective territories for those purposes against other States or their citizens;
textWithHighlights: Prevent those who finance, plan, facilitate or commit terrorist acts from using their respective territories for those purposes against {{other States}} or their citizens;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause "Decides (also) that all States shall:"; the paragraph itself does not restate them. No concrete deliverable category applies beyond the general obligation to prevent use of territory.

text: Ensure that any person who participates in the financing, planning, preparation or perpetration of terrorist acts or in supporting terrorist acts is brought to justice and ensure that, in addition to any other measures against them, such terrorist acts are established as serious criminal offences in domestic laws and regulations and that the punishment duly reflects the seriousness of such terrorist acts;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Bring perpetrators to justice
Criminalize terrorist acts in domestic law
Ensure proportionate punishment for terrorist acts

textWithHighlights: Ensure that any person who participates in the financing, planning, preparation or perpetration of terrorist acts or in supporting terrorist acts is [[brought to justice]] and ensure that, in addition to any other measures against them, such terrorist acts are [[established as serious criminal offences]] in domestic laws and regulations and that the [[punishment duly reflects the seriousness]] of such terrorist acts;
uncertainties: Mapped 'brought to justice' to deliverable type 'policy' due to lack of a dedicated enforcement/prosecution category.

text: Afford one another the greatest measure of assistance in connection with criminal investigations or criminal proceedings relating to the financing or support of terrorist acts, including assistance in obtaining evidence in their possession necessary for the proceedings;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assistance for criminal investigations and proceedings on terrorism financing/support
deliverables.deliverable: assistance in connection with criminal investigations or criminal proceedings

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assistance in obtaining evidence for proceedings

textWithHighlights: Afford one another the greatest measure of [[assistance in connection with criminal investigations or criminal proceedings]] relating to the financing or support of terrorist acts, including [[assistance in obtaining evidence]] in their possession necessary for the proceedings;
uncertainties: Classified general assistance as technical_assistance and evidence-related cooperation as information_sharing; this could also be viewed broadly as mutual legal assistance.

text: Prevent the movement of terrorists or terrorist groups by effective border controls and controls on issuance of identity papers and travel documents, and through measures for preventing counterfeiting, forgery or fraudulent use of identity papers and travel documents;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: effective border controls
controls on issuance of identity papers and travel documents
deliverables.deliverable: controls on issuance of identity papers and travel documents

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: measures preventing counterfeiting, forgery or fraudulent use of identity papers and travel documents
deliverables.deliverable: measures for preventing counterfeiting, forgery or fraudulent use of identity papers and travel documents

textWithHighlights: Prevent the movement of terrorists or terrorist groups by [[effective border controls]] and [[controls on issuance of identity papers and travel documents]], and through [[measures for preventing counterfeiting, forgery or fraudulent use of identity papers and travel documents]];
uncertainties: Assignee is inherited from the parent clause ('all States shall'), i.e., Member States. It is not present in this subparagraph text, so assignees are left empty to keep highlights consistent.

text: Calls upon all States to:
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<all States>> to:
uncertainties: This is a lead-in clause; specific tasks are expected in subsequent subparagraphs that inherit the directive "call upon" with assignee Member States.

text: Find ways of intensifying and accelerating the exchange of operational information, especially regarding actions or movements of terrorist persons or networks; forged or falsified travel documents; traffic in arms, explosives or sensitive materials; use of communications technologies by terrorist groups; and the threat posed by the possession of weapons of mass destruction by terrorist groups;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Intensify and accelerate exchange of operational information on terrorism

textWithHighlights: Find ways of intensifying and accelerating the [[exchange of operational information]], especially regarding actions or movements of terrorist persons or networks; forged or falsified travel documents; traffic in arms, explosives or sensitive materials; use of communications technologies by terrorist groups; and the threat posed by the possession of weapons of mass destruction by terrorist groups;

text: Exchange information in accordance with international and domestic law and cooperate on administrative and judicial matters to prevent the commission of terrorist acts;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: information exchange
cooperation on administrative and judicial matters
deliverables.deliverable: cooperate on administrative and judicial matters

textWithHighlights: [[Exchange information]] in accordance with international and domestic law and [[cooperate on administrative and judicial matters]] to prevent the commission of terrorist acts;
uncertainties: Operative verb and assignee are inherited from the parent clause "Calls upon all States to:" and thus do not appear in this subparagraph text. Classified "cooperate on administrative and judicial matters" as technical_assistance; this mapping is approximate, as cooperation is broader than assistance.

text: Cooperate, particularly through bilateral and multilateral arrangements and agreements, to prevent and suppress terrorist attacks and take action against perpetrators of such acts;
textWithHighlights: Cooperate, particularly through bilateral and multilateral arrangements and agreements, to prevent and suppress terrorist attacks and take action against perpetrators of such acts;
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears to inherit the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause "Calls upon all States to:" rather than from the "Decides ..." clauses listed in the context.

text: Become parties as soon as possible to the relevant international conventions and protocols relating to terrorism, including the International Convention for the Suppression of the Financing of Terrorism of 9 December 1999;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Accession to relevant counter-terrorism conventions and protocols

textWithHighlights: [[Become parties]] as soon as possible to the relevant international conventions and protocols relating to terrorism, including the International Convention for the Suppression of the Financing of Terrorism of 9 December 1999;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause "Calls upon all States to:" (i.e., Member States), but the assignee does not appear in the subparagraph text, so it is not highlighted and is omitted from the assignees list.

text: Increase cooperation and fully implement the relevant international conventions and protocols relating to terrorism and Security Council resolutions 1269 (1999) and 1368 (2001);

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Implementation of relevant international conventions and protocols relating to terrorism
Implementation of Security Council resolutions 1269 (1999) and 1368 (2001)

textWithHighlights: Increase cooperation and fully implement the relevant [[international conventions and protocols]] relating to terrorism and {{Security Council}} [[resolutions 1269 (1999) and 1368 (2001)]];
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause "Calls upon all States to:". "Increase cooperation" is considered too vague to extract as a concrete deliverable.

text: Take appropriate measures in conformity with the relevant provisions of national and international law, including international standards of human rights, before granting refugee status, for the purpose of ensuring that the asylum-seeker has not planned, facilitated or participated in the commission of terrorist acts;
textWithHighlights: Take appropriate measures in conformity with the relevant provisions of national and international law, including international standards of human rights, before granting refugee status, for the purpose of ensuring that the asylum-seeker has not planned, facilitated or participated in the commission of terrorist acts;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause "Calls upon all States to:". The phrase "Take appropriate measures" is considered too vague to mark as a concrete deliverable.

text: Ensure, in conformity with international law, that refugee status is not abused by the perpetrators, organizers or facilitators of terrorist acts, and that claims of political motivation are not recognized as grounds for refusing requests for the extradition of alleged terrorists;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Prevent abuse of refugee status by terrorists
Do not recognize political motivation as grounds to refuse extradition of alleged terrorists
deliverables.deliverable: claims of political motivation are not recognized

textWithHighlights: Ensure, in conformity with international law, that [[refugee status is not abused]] by the perpetrators, organizers or facilitators of terrorist acts, and that [[claims of political motivation are not recognized]] as grounds for refusing requests for the extradition of alleged terrorists;

text: Notes with concern the close connection between international terrorism and transnational organized crime, illicit drugs, money-laundering, illegal arms-trafficking, and illegal movement of nuclear, chemical, biological and other potentially deadly materials, and in this regard emphasizes the need to enhance coordination of efforts on national, subregional, regional and international levels in order to strengthen a global response to this serious challenge and threat to international security;
textWithHighlights: *Notes with concern* the close connection between international terrorism and transnational organized crime, illicit drugs, money-laundering, illegal arms-trafficking, and illegal movement of nuclear, chemical, biological and other potentially deadly materials, and in this regard *emphasizes* the need to enhance coordination of efforts on national, subregional, regional and international levels in order to strengthen a global response to this serious challenge and threat to international security;

text: Declares that acts, methods, and practices of terrorism are contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations and that knowingly financing, planning and inciting terrorist acts are also contrary to the purposes and principles of the United Nations;
textWithHighlights: *Declares* that acts, methods, and practices of terrorism are contrary to the purposes and principles of the {{United Nations}} and that knowingly financing, planning and inciting terrorist acts are also contrary to the purposes and principles of the {{United Nations}};

text: Decides to establish, in accordance with rule 28 of its provisional rules of procedure, a Committee of the Security Council, consisting of all the members of the Council, to monitor implementation of this resolution, with the assistance of appropriate expertise, and calls upon all States to report to the Committee, no later than 90 days from the date of adoption of this resolution and thereafter according to a timetable to be proposed by the Committee, on the steps they have taken to implement this resolution;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Security Council Committee to monitor implementation
Reports on steps taken to implement the resolution

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to establish, in accordance with rule 28 of its provisional rules of procedure, a [[Committee]] of the {{Security Council}}, consisting of all the members of the Council, to monitor implementation of this resolution, with the assistance of appropriate expertise, and *calls upon* <<all States>> to [[report]] to the {{Committee}}, no later than 90 days from the date of adoption of this resolution and thereafter according to a timetable to be proposed by the Committee, on the steps they have taken to implement this resolution;
uncertainties: Classifying the establishment of a committee as a 'policy' deliverable is a best-fit; there is no dedicated category for creating bodies. The phrase 'to monitor implementation' indicates the Committeeâ€™s function but is not modeled as a separate directive to the Committee in this paragraph.

text: Directs the Committee to delineate its tasks, submit a work programme within 30 days of the adoption of this resolution, and to consider the support it requires, in consultation with the Secretary-General;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Definition of tasks
Work programme

textWithHighlights: *Directs* the <<Committee>> to [[delineate its tasks]], submit a [[work programme]] within 30 days of the adoption of this resolution, and to consider the support it requires, in consultation with the {{Secretary-General}};
uncertainties: The "Committee" likely refers to the Security Council Counter-Terrorism Committee (CTC) established in the preceding paragraph; normalized as "SC Committee (CTC)" though the exact title is not in the entity list. Classification of "delineate its tasks" as a deliverable of type "strategy" could alternatively be seen as policy/organizational setup. The instruction to "consider the support it requires" is not treated as a concrete deliverable (could be viewed as analysis).

text: Expresses its determination to take all necessary steps in order to ensure the full implementation of this resolution, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses its determination* to take all necessary steps in order to ensure the full implementation of this resolution, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter;

text: Decides to remain seized of this matter.
textWithHighlights: *Decides* to remain seized of this matter.
